resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

shyambits2004 commented on pull request #3352: ARROW-4198 : [Gandiva] Added support to cast timestamp

   Added howard hinnant date project as a third party library.
   Used system timezone database for timezone information.

wesm commented on issue #3352: ARROW-4198 : [Gandiva] Added support to cast timestamp
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3352#issuecomment-452381877
 
 
   @shyambits2004 we are already vendoring part of this library: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/vendored/date.h. I suggest that we vendor all the parts that Gandiva needs instead of adding more stuff to the thirdparty toolchain
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

shyambits2004 commented on issue #3352: ARROW-4198 : [Gandiva] Added support to cast timestamp
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3352#issuecomment-452385758
 
 
   @wesm 
   
   There are less than 10 files in that project and we need the most of them (if I remember it right, I tried including one by one) for time zone support. So, it seemed good idea to add it as a third party library instead of selected files.

wesm commented on issue #3352: ARROW-4198 : [Gandiva] Added support to cast timestamp
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3352#issuecomment-452398902
 
 
   Even though it's a small component, we would need to add it to conda-forge or other package managers. It would need to be configured for offline builds (https://github.com/apache/arrow/tree/master/cpp/thirdparty). It is more work than vendoring given that the component is quite simple. Others (@pitrou @xhochy etc) may have other opinions so am interested to see them
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #3352: ARROW-4198: [Gandiva] Added support to cast timestamp
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3352#issuecomment-452459864
 
 
   You can create a subdirectory for this in `arrow/vendored` (since there are multiple files, arrow/vendored/date.h can be nested inside a new directory). Since this change introduces compiled symbols, they may need to be exported with ARROW_EXPORT. There will doubtlessly be other parts of the Arrow project where date/time/tz utilities will be used so having them part of the Arrow tree is the simplest thing right now
   
   I feel that having gandiva as a child of the arrow/ directory (and `arrow::gandiva` namespace) makes as much or more sense than the current structure
   
   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3359
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
